text:
docu at http://java.sun.com/products/jsp/tags/12/syntaxref1216.html#8856 says:
"The <jsp:setProperty> element sets the value of one or more properties in a 
bean, using the bean's setter methods. You must declare the bean with 
<jsp:useBean> before you set a property value with <jsp:setProperty>."

The absence of the <jsp:useBean> declaration can be detected at compile time, 
so it SHOULD be detected at compile time.

The current test treats the compile time detection as an error.
creator: s.franke@bebbosoft.de

text:
Not sure why you're quoting setProperty semantics for a getProperty test.

However, a jsp:useBean is not necessary before a call to jsp:getProperty as the
object upon which the action is applied could have been introduced by a custom
action ahead of time.

See section 4.2, 5th paragraph.
creator: Ryan.Lubke@Sun.COM
s.franke@bebbosoft.de
text: Seems as I overlooked the VariableInfo based objects.
